entry.title: Plans paused for older adult living community at SOU
entry.summary: Southern Oregon University’s project to create an older adult living community on its Ashland campus has been paused after one of the two companies being considered as partners with the university withdrew its response to SOU’s request for proposal. SOU will take time to consider what potential partnerships may look like before possibly issuing a new request for… The post Plans paused for older adult living community at SOU appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 01.21.26
entry.summary: Erin Maidlow of Umpqua Valley Farm to School talks about garden plots that are available at the Umpqua Dairy Garden.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested After Alleged BB Gun Robbery, Witness Tampering
entry.summary: Roseburg police arrested a 32-year-old man after officers reported he pointed a BB gun at a woman, demanded her wallet, and later contacted her about the case. He was lodged at Douglas County Corrections on robbery, weapon, and witness tampering charges.

entry.title: Police Log: January 20, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests and citations in the latest logs, including a first degree robbery allegation involving a BB gun, several warrant and probation contacts, and city ordinance cases such as prohibited camping and leash law violations.

entry.title: North Umpqua Outfitters Offering Free Umpqua River Fishing Trip for Veterans and First Responders
entry.summary: North Umpqua Outfitters is offering a free guided fishing trip on the Umpqua River for veterans and first responders. The drift boat outing includes fishing gear, lunch, and drinks, and lasts about 5 to 6 hours. Participants must bring an Oregon fishing license and Salmon Steelhead tag.

entry.title: Drain's Ray's Food Place to close by end of February
entry.summary: On Tuesday, Drain resident Nancy Whitlock was out for a morning walk when she passed the Ray's Food Place and saw a new sign hanging from the side of the building, which reads "Store Closing. Everything Must Go!"

entry.title: UACT organizing father/daughter dance, tickets now on sale
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Umpqua Actors Community Theatre is now organizing the Douglas County Father/Daughter Winter Wonderland Dance.

entry.title: 55th annual Greatest of the Grape tickets on sale
entry.summary: CANYONVILLE — Tickets are now on sale for the 55th annual Greatest of the Grape event.

entry.title: Maintenance inspection to briefly close Stewart Park Drive Bridge
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Stewart Park Drive Bridge in Roseburg will be closed to vehicle and pedestrian traffic during a maintenance inspection on Thursday.

entry.title: Partnership to host great horned owl researcher
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Umpqua Valley Audubon and Roseburg Public Library invite the public to a presentation on great horned owls by Colorado researcher Scott Rashid.

entry.title: UCC Women’s Basketball Coach Dave Stricklin Earns 1,000th Career Win in Riverhawks Victory
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College women’s basketball coach Dave Stricklin earned the 1,000th win of his junior college career Jan. 19 as the Riverhawks beat Portland Community College 89-60. UCC will recognize the milestone with an on-court ceremony Jan. 25.

entry.title: Roseburg library hosts photography exhibit
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Public Library invites the community to enjoy “The Power of Place,” a photography exhibit currently on loan from the Oregon Historical Society.

entry.title: North Douglas County Fire & EMS Receives Two SPIRE Grants for New Rescue Tools and Thermal Drone
entry.summary: North Douglas County Fire & EMS received two SPIRE grants from Oregon Emergency Management, funding new Holmatro battery rescue tools for vehicle extrication and a thermal imaging drone to boost search and rescue and scene awareness. Crews are now training with the equipment.

entry.title: Adapt Integrated Health Care Notifies Patients of Vendor-Related Security Incident Involving TriZetto
entry.summary: Adapt Integrated Health Care says a vendor-related security incident at TriZetto may have involved some patient info, including names, SSNs, and insurance details. Adapt systems were not breached. Impacted patients will be notified starting Feb. 2026.

entry.title: NLRB Dismisses Union Complaints Against Bigfoot Beverages, Company Says
entry.summary: Bigfoot Beverages says the NLRB dismissed seven unfair labor practice charges filed by Teamsters Locals 206 and 324, calling them lacking in merit. The strike began Sept. 19, 2024, and continues as the labor dispute remains unresolved.

entry.title: MLK Day of Service Brings Roseburg Together for River Cleanup and Invasive Species Removal
entry.summary: Roseburg volunteers marked MLK Day with hands-on service across Stewart Park, Eastwood Nature Park, and the Duck Pond, removing trash, pulling invasive plants, and installing educational signs as part of Umpqua Watersheds’ annual restoration event.

entry.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse celebrates over 130 years of operation
entry.summary: WINCHESTER BAY — In 1894, the wick of the rebuilt Umpqua River Lighthouse was lit for the first time, guiding sailors through the mist and fog of the Oregon coast.

entry.title: Sustainability, creativity, drinkability: Inside Stillwagon Distillery
entry.summary: Reedsport’s Stillwagon Distillery is an institution of two personalities. On one side, guests are welcomed into the easygoing tasting room, a tiki bar that feels like it was picked up from a tropical island and dropped onto the Oregon coast.

entry.title: Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation Awards $759,930 to 93 Southern Oregon Nonprofits
entry.summary: The Cow Creek Umpqua Indian Foundation awarded $759,930 in grants to 93 nonprofit organizations across seven Southern Oregon counties during its winter awards ceremony at Seven Feathers Casino Resort. Total giving since 1997 is now $27.2 million.
